text: Lorenzo Acquarone (25 February 1931 – 24 March 2020) was an Italian lawyer and politician. He was born in Ventimiglia. Between 1987 and 2006, he served as a member of the Senate and the Chamber of Deputies. On 24 March 2020, during the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic, Acquarone died in Genoa due to COVID-19. He was 89. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy Category:Politicians from Liguria
title: Lorenzo Acquarone
